alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Forsyth, northeastern Gwinnett and southwestern Hall Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Buford, or 8 miles southeast of Cumming. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Cumming, Sugar Hill, Suwanee, Buford, Flowery Branch, Oakwood, Rest Haven, Buford Dam-Lake Lanier Parks, Aqualand Park, Oscarville, Lake Lanier Islands and Hog Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
